heinzketchuppp: @shanboody Idk if you’ve ever heard this perspective but I recently realized that I had been operating as a nice girl in my relationships/situations with men! My identity was literally rooted in being the nice good girl. But I too had to do the inward work of asking myself what else do I bring to the table other than being a nice good girl? And when I really got down to the heart of it, I have an abundance of qualities I can possibly bring to the table however I wasn’t 100% confident in those qualities. What I am 100% confident is I can be nice. I can be a doormat. Pick me, I’m a people pleaser! That’s what I was taught kept a man...basically not being my true self. And when they didn’t pick me the people pleaser I’m salty because I was ready to quite literally give up everything for them. But they don’t want that...and truth be told neither did I. I didn’t want to be that person, but I just wasn’t sure if being my true authentic self was worth it (isn’t that crazy?). For me, It’s about being confident in everything that you are with or without someone and standing in that. I’m operating in the space now that I am amazing. I am intelligent, funny, sexy, the coolest girl you’ll ever meet. I can’t wait to try again whenever the time is right and bring all of those things to the table instead and see what comes happens.
